result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominion M. Koppen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dominion M. Koppen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dominion M. Koppen was found guilty of Knowingly Violate Child Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.122(11).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Koppen, Dominion M.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt & Judgment for unpaid fines/forfeitures/other

Defendant Dominion M. Koppen appeared by phone, in custody from DCI.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Dominion M. Koppen. Defendant is willing to proceed with sentencing by phone. Attorney Richards has submitted plea questionnaire prior to todays hearing. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1 and state will move to dismiss Ct 2. State will remain silent but advise court of his prior record. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant of Ct 1. Ct 2 dismissed per agreement. State heard. Attorney Richards heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 30 day in jail concurrent to current sentence, court costs, and DNA.
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Dominion M. Koppen appeared by phone from DCI, Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Dominion M. Koppen, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives further reading and stands mute. Court enters NG Plea. Status: 4/13/22 at 11:30 am. Defendant will be via phone. JT weeks 4/26 and 5/3.
Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Arraignment on March 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

You may join this hearing by video using the following website: https://wicourts.zoom.us/j/600348151 (meeting ID: 600-348-151).  To appear by video, you will need a web camera and microphone.  If you are unable to join by internet using video, you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: 600-348-151). If you wish to appear in person, please contact Judge VanDeHey's Judicial Assistant at (608) 723-7826.
DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH G.J. AND FAMILY.

Defendant Dominion M. Koppen appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant heard and wants to resolve without counsel before going to prison. Court will address Friday morning prior to move to prison. Court again reviews advantage of having counsel. Defendant still wants to proceed without counsel. Contact SPD if defendant decides to obtain counsel. Court sets arraignment  State requests signature bond with no contact with victim. Court sets bond at $1000 signature with no contact.
Arraignment scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
